Argent, a chevron between three porcs sable

Notes: Elias SYDALL, Bishop of St.David's 1731; Gloucester, 1731-33.
Blazon: Argent, a chevron between three carpenter's squares, the angles in sinister chief, gules

Notes: SYKES, late of Basildon, co. Berks.

Notes: Archibald Campbell TAIT, Bp. of London, 1856; Abp. of Canterbury, 1868-82.

Notes: TALLOW-CHANDLERS' Company, London. [Arms and crest granted, Sept. 24, 1463.]

Notes: Company of TAUYERS[or GREYTAWYERS, i.e. dressers of white leather], London; [Arms granted, 1531].
